Reviews.Title: “another Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: paolaPPVpaola
Reviews.Content: asian side is usually not considered by tourists who are unaware of the "other world". Close to Bagdat Caddesi, the hippiest streets for fashion and design (all famous fashion brands and designer shops are here!), and a few steps away form the seaside, Suadiye offers a superb fitness club in front and most of crowdest clubs in the neighbourhood. Wi-fi is everywhere. Breakfast is poor compared to hotel level but in the neighbourhood "simit" and any possible delicacy can be found around every corner. Taksim is reachable by dolmus for a very cheap fare.

Reviews.Title: “Well located pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: menolis
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in the Asian side of Istanbul Suadiye is certainly a hotel you can consider. I spent one night for business purposes and in general I think it offers good value for money. Arriving at the hotel, you can leave your car in the entrance where a personnel member will move it to the free hotel parking. The personnel is very pleasant, helpful and quick while their English are quite okay. Room size at least in my case was standard and very clean. View was nothing special as I did not get sea view but the buildings are not next to each other - space is quite open. The mattress was not exceptional but good enough to sleep well. Bathroom was spacious, clean and elegant. I chose a smoking room and they gave me 5th floor. Breakfast was served from 7 to 10. The selection was quite big (fruits, cheese, hams, eggs) but I think it could have been a bit more "europeanised". Hotel location is excellent as Baghdad street is 50 meters away. You have a wide range of shops - in most cases luxurious brands - a lot of restaurants and a few bars. Overall I do recommend this hotel if you are going for a few days. Having checked other hotels in the area - location wise this seems to be the best one. Enjoy/

Reviews.Title: “A pretty Good place if You Need To Be On The Asian Side Of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Paul_In_Basel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in Octoner/November 2011. On the whole the rooms were clean and well kept and the hotel efficient. The sea view rooms have no balcony so you can not sit out. At the back go for a higher floor away from kitchen noise and cooling fan hum but even the lower floors are OK. Rooms facing the road are opposite a night club in the roof of the opposite building but I never heard them else where. Buffet breakfast was good turkish and european food so something for everyone. I did not eat dinner here there are plenty of restaurants at the top of the road. Congrats to the hotel on their free wifi service a good strong signal and a fast speed of 7 m bits which was adequate to run iPlayer. Usually free wifi is pathetique around 0.5 m bits so well done on this. If you want to go to the european side catch a taxi to the Sirecki Harem ferry boat 15tl and take the ferry to the other side 2 tl 15 mins. Do not go via the bridge it can take ages in traffic. A bit down form the ferry boat by the bridge have a tasty grilled mackrel fillets in a bread roll served from the grill boats moored in the river.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Threeholer
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel located on the Asian side. Rooms were tiny, but spotlessly clean. The double room would be too tight for two. Location is very safe and you can go walkabout at night. Close to Baghdad Street, which is the centre of activity. For that area, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DaKe72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, best for short business trips. Quite good location. Beware the tiny beds...

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: Agent424
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is not remarkable but fine for a two to three night stay. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is great near shopping and the ferry terminal. It is a bit of a run to the airport which is about 30 minutes and 60TL.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Home”
Reviews.Author: Concierge34
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, good food and excellent staff. Thanks to their GM Murat Yumak, Reservation Manager Mrs.Tulay Sevim. If you need and assistance about your Laptop just ask for Mr. Burak and see how professional he is. If you are looking for a five star hotel atmosphere I should tell you that you are at the wrong hotel. This is a very friendly hotel where you can feel yourself at home. A very special thanks to the owner Mr. Erkan SadÄ±koglu. I felt that they are all like a big family. When you arrive just ask for these names and see what will happen..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aiko_jk
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel second time.the room was big and clean.the breakfast was good. Staffs were friendly and kind.we can relax at the room as home. Also free Internet wifi was fast. Close to the Bagdat street. There are many bars and cafe restaurant. Also there are many brand shops. We like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a night”
Reviews.Author: G6rby
Reviews.Content: Here on business for a night. They arranged taxi from Ataturk airport across bridge to Asian side. Close to the sea. I arrived late-ish. Rooms fine but "garden view" is somewhat of an over statement (view of roof/concrete carpark). Breakfast basic but okay. Value average EU 99/night in breakfast in cool October. No real complaints

Reviews.Title: “well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MUC-BCN
Reviews.Content: -the hotel is well located in a nice area of Istanbul (shops, restaurants...in walking distance) -very friendly and english speaking staff -clean rooms -size of the rooms, rather small, but seems to be standard in Turkey -very cool hotel bar -internet connection free and easy to access The taxi from AtatÃ¼rk airport to the hotel is about â‚¬ 35.-

Reviews.Title: “Wasted location”
Reviews.Author: CPLongIsland
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great location - close to the Bagdat Ave., a favorite venue among the locals with its numerous cafes, restaurants and boutiques as well as the seaside park where one can take a pleasant stroll. It used to be rather drab before the major refurbishment it underwent three years ago. Evidently they didn't do a good job as one quickly discovers after a night's stay. We stayed 4+3 nights at Suadiye Hotel. Because of the following issues we will never go back there: (1) Even though our room was designated "non-smoking," someone else was smoking in one of the neighboring rooms (which might also have been "non-smoking but the guest violated the rule) our room stank; (2) There was an awful smell coming from the shower drainage. The housekeeper knew about it and said "It happens when it rains!" I had to cover it with a plastic bag; (3) The breakfast (included in the price) never changed (in seven days) and was really bad. The rooms facing the street are very noisy (we were given one them and we had to demand a different room.) In summary the hotel does not deserve its star rating and I would not recommend it to my friend. The personnel were, in general, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: LucianMM
Reviews.Content: Located in a very nice area of the Asian side of Istanbul, the hotel offered me a rather good experience. It is close to the Marmara Sea and they do have rooms with sea view. It is 3 minutes walking from Bagdad Street, famous for shopping among locals but not necessarily for tourists which makes it not crowded and quite pleasant. The service was typical for Turkey, meaning friendly, genuine smiles and helpful. I have seen better in Turkey though. The rooms were clean, the double on the first floor was spacious enough but the single on the 3rd floor (a colleague stayed there) was rather small. Good amenities, with bath robe and slippers as well as free wi-fi in the room. The only downside was the unpleasant smell in my room that became unnoticeable after few minutes though. The food in the restaurant was very good. The breakfast was ok. I would recommend this hotel if you have Business on the Asian side , Fenerbahce, Moda areas. Time to airport by taxi was 30 minutes on an early Sunday Morning and a bit over one hour on a Thursday mid day. It can take more during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “May look like a 4 * but it really isn't”
Reviews.Author: Joris_R
Reviews.Content: If you want to be or need to be on the Asian side of Istanbul, this hotel offers a quite good location. However: at first it all looks shiny and classy, but that will disappear if you scratch the outside layers. The room was super small. And that applies to everything in the room: bed, bathroom and working table. The bathroom, while well equipped, is tiny. The "table" will not allow you to do any work and doesn't even come with a proper chair. Charging a laptop or mobile phone is not easy either. I was booked in what is optimistically called a "garden view" room. What you really see is the roof of the adjacent building and part of a parking lot. And catching up on the TV news was a challenge as you need to operate two remotes without instructions. Breakfast was truly poor, and not at all up to Turkish standards. Overall, service was friendly but quite poor & inefficient, and well below what one would expect in Turkey. Upon arrival nobody appeared to bother to speed up the check-in process. In the breakfast area the young waiters and waitresses didnt really know what to do and were more interested in chatting amongst them instead of helping customers. The bar, whilst flashy and offering good service, is unfortunately a rather sad place to visit as there are as good as no customers. All in all an OK hotel for a one night stay after a long travel or in between meetings.

Reviews.Title: “a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Fletscher
Reviews.Content: the hotel on the Asian side of Istanbul is very nice located - very close to the beach and to the shopping avenue. the room is OK sized, not too big though. unfortunately the toilett is to close to the shower, so you have to sit kind of uncomfortable. However, the shower is great - I always appreciate good pressure and enough space. the breakfast has a big variety of cheese to offer, besides it is not very rich of choice. The price of approx. EUR130/night seems a bit too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Ania_978
Reviews.Content: I was on few days business trip in Turkey, and we stayed in Suadiye hotel. I have nothing to complain about. Stunning view at the sea, very large room, which I loved, super clean and comfortable bathroom, friendly staff, delicious breakfast., taxi arrived on time. Simply - everything was in line with my expectations. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent refurbished hotel with dedicated staff”
Reviews.Author: whiteboots
Reviews.Content: Well run friendly, clean, excellent location near to the sea front and first class shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: Horatio061
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed in an ideal location with numerous good restaurants to choose from a short walk away, the hotel has recently been refurbished to a high standard, the staff are welcoming and helpful. English is spoken well. The internet connection is free and fast a must nowadays. The restaurant in the hotel was both reasonable on cost and very good on quality. Parking is made easy by the jockeys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel after major refurbishment, best on Asian side”
Reviews.Author: MAIDENHEADUK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over 15 years or more as it is one of the few classy hotels on the Asian side and convenient for my business in Kadikoy . I was overwhelmed at the extensive refurbishment of the public areas since my last stay. They have taken over restaurant next door thus hugely expanding dining and bar facilities. The buffet breakfast is much better than before. Really friendly and helpful staff too. Rooms are also very spacious with excellent showers and free fast internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Spectre968
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed one of the seviewed room at this hotel for 3days and 2 nights. we really had a great holiday. distance to the sea is just 50m. and there wasnt any obstacle to see the amazing view of the Marmara sea. The hotel is really close to the Bagdat street (300m.). All of the worldwide known brands and cafes are located on this street. Open buffet breakfest and roomservice is favorable. During our holiday they offered special rate (128 Euro for seviewed rooms and 99 Euro for gardenviewed rooms, not for per person) due to "Kurban Bayram (kind of holiday for Muslims)". They asked approx. 50 Euros deposit for minibar usage. If you dont use minibar, they give money back while you are checking out. Finally staff is very kind and good-humored.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: serrita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with a friend while we attended a tango festival nearby. It was being renovated but it did not affect the room we stayed in or the common areas. The dining room was a bit dismal, overlooking two busy thoroughfares but I assume it will be moved to have a sea view once the renovations are completed. The rooms were well-decorated, clean, and quiet. The toiletries, towels, and beddings were of excellent quality. The breakfast buffet was spectacular with fresh fruits, vegetables, pastries, cheeses, jams, yogurt, cereal, etc. with some cooked dishes that remained well-supplied until the very end of the breakfast hour. The hotel is walking distance from Bagdad Caddesi, which is a very busy commerical strip with numerous restaurants, cafes, and bars, and boutiques, as well as easy access to public transportation. However, if you are in Istnabul for historic sight-seeing, it is too far from any of the famous landmarks. The price was as high as you would expect in any major European capital - which is too say, too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? Not really... an expensive & unfriendly construction site”
Reviews.Author: Stag_01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is horrible. The last time I was staying there was in August 2010 on a business trip and a hotel was more like a construction site. Reception desk was improvised in the middle of construction, however there was not a single word about apologies to the hotel guests. Staff was unfriendly as usually, service at the breakfast equally slow as it always used to be. The girl there was busy ticking off the guests coming to breakfast but I have not seen any of such efforts in getting coffee to the same. Room was an extra charge because of the sea view but all you can see through the dirty windows is a bunch of construction workers moving around really slow. And yes, the whole entertainment will cost you quite a decent sum (+ a surcharge, if youâ€™re using AMEX). If you like staying at an expensive construction site, surrounded by an unfriendly staff, thatâ€™s the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location and marvelous seaview...”
Reviews.Author: SemraTemel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Suadiye before and after the renovation.The rooms are new refurnished and the atmosphere is improved incredibly.I recommend the new face of Hotel Suadiye for a comfortable and save stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best I stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Tommmel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of a three week business trip from Paris to Norway to Germany and then Turkey. I stayed in comparable hotels along the way. None were as nice as this hotel. The rooms were clean AND quiet. The hotel is older but has been renocvated and the rooms look very nice. Everything works! That is a novel idea! I didn't find that anywhere else. I wish I could stay at places like Hotel Suadiye at every stop in my travels. The location is safe. The sea is right there. There is Bada Street within a an easy walk with restuarants and shopping. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Ã‡ok gÃ¼zel olmuÅŸ”
Reviews.Author: Travel1907
Reviews.Content: YÄ±llardÄ±r bu nezih otele gider gelirim iÅŸlerim icabÄ±, yenilenmiÅŸ son haliyle emsal otelleri kÄ±skandÄ±racak bir hale gelmiÅŸ. Tebrik ederim.

Reviews.Title: “Dosn't worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Rezagh
Reviews.Content: The most attarctive thing there is the location which is beside bosphorus, apart from that, other things are not good, the hotel is very old and rates are high, moreover, it is not very clean place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible initial impression, but it improved”
Reviews.Author: deprosecutor
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Suadiye was arranged by a friend at, apparently, a great discount. This is one of the few hotels on the Asian side of Istanbul. While not convenient to the historical sights on the European side, the hotel is just a short distance from the great shopping on Baghdad Street. I was initially given an unrenovated room with a sea view. This room was my worst nightmare - the carpet was stained by what appeared to be wine, the mattress was hard as a rock, and the room was poorly lit. When my friend saw the room I had been given, she immediately complained and I was moved to one of the renovated rooms. These rooms are beautiful - very well appointed with LCD TVs, plush carpet, nice bathrooms, and a decent mattress. Though the room did not face the sea, it was at least worth the (still rather high) price I paid. The concierge staff was not particularly friendly - bordering on surly. I would not recommend this hotel for those who do not speak Turkish.

Reviews.Title: “refurbished rooms are good”
Reviews.Author: espen_9
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately there are not many options to get decent accomdation on the Asian side. Suadiye is a good option due to its excellent location by the sea, close to restaurants and shoping area. The hotel is in refurbishing process. Rooms that are ready look excellent comparing to the old ones (make sure you ask to be accomodated in one of those). Breakfast is ok. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Although it is impossible to make everyone happy the entire staff works very hard to make your stay as comfortable as possible.”
Reviews.Author: goztepeKentucky
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Hotel Suadiye because it was very close to my aunt and uncle's home and highly recommended by my family and friends in Turkey. The staff and the hotel met all of our needs ranging from location, comfort and dining. Our family and friends reunion dinner at the hotel was a delicious experience. Make time and leave room for the chocolate souffle. Everyone left happy that night and we were very grateful to the staff for their genuine kindness and caring. Sincerely, Charles and Selma Stewart Benton, Kentucky U.S.A

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scoubidou123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite horrible. At check-in the staff was barely friendly. I was staying on the 4th floor. There is moisture in the hall next to the lift. The rooms are worn out. The furniture is in poor state and there is carpet missing here and there. Getting a shower was an interesting experience as the water tabs were turning in the wall themselves. This is way over-priced for what you get here. One nice aspect is the view on the sea (a bit further of) if you're on the right side.

Reviews.Title: “Uff...”
Reviews.Author: AndreaHen
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the asian side, and you need to stay in the 'center' - maybe. But if you need a decent hotel, do not stay there. The rooms were...holes on everything (walls etc), broken furnitures etc - we were supposed to stay there a week, and we left after one night. It was not even a one star hotel. But if you need the location, ok. The Italian restaurant next to the hotel was great though :)

Reviews.Title: “Godd location but very old accommodation”
Reviews.Author: SofiaFord
Reviews.Content: Business trip 12 nights. First point - it is not 4* hotel. By average West European standards is is about 2*+. Far too expensive for the quality of service and accommodation. Positives: Great location - many restaurants and shops within 5 min walk. If you have business in the Asian part of Istanbul -much easier to get around compare to Marriot. Friendly staff. Gym was old but ok. Negatives: At the price of 190 EUR/night you get 20-30 years old room. Very old carpets. Cleaned every day but all the stains makes it look dirty. Narrow 2 single beds with rock hard mattress and small cheap pillow. TV the size of a post stamp. Disintegrating draws and shelves. Air-conditioning virtually non existent.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Suadiye
HotelInfo.Address: Plaj yolu No 51, Istanbul 34740, Turkey
